meanings.definition: A feat displaying unusual skill or daring, especially one performed in public.
meanings.sent1: The circus performer executed a daring stunt on the tightrope.
meanings.sent2: The action movie star performed a dangerous stunt for the film.
meanings.sent3: The clown's silly stunt made everyone laugh at the circus.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to juggle multiple tasks at once was a real stunt of talent.
meanings.sent5: The skateboarder's stunt off the ramp was unforgettable.

meanings.definition: To hinder the normal growth, development, or progress of.
meanings.sent1: Eating too much junk food can stunt your growth.
meanings.sent2: The lack of sunlight can stunt the plant's growth.
meanings.sent3: Procrastinating on your homework will only stunt your progress.
meanings.sent4: Negative thoughts can stunt your personal development.
meanings.sent5: Ignoring feedback can stunt your improvement in any skill.
